text: Welcome to the Real World is the second studio album by American pop rock band Mr. Mister. It was released on November 27, 1985, by RCA Victor. Two singles from the album, "Broken Wings" and "Kyrie", both topped the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, while "Is It Love" peaked at number eight. Welcome to the Real World topped the Billboard 200 chart in early 1986. A remastered 25th- anniversary edition of the album was released as a digipak on April 20, 2010. ==Track listing== ==Personnel== Credits adapted from the liner notes of Welcome to the Real World. ;Mr. Mister * Richard Page – lead vocals, bass * Steve George – keyboards, vocals * Pat Mastelotto – drums, drum machines such as LinnDrum/Linn LM-1 (tracks 6 and 8), acoustic and electronic percussion * Steve Farris – guitars ;Additional personnel * John Lang – lyrics * Jack Manning, Casey Young – additional keyboards such as the Roland S-50 (track 6), Yamaha DX7 and Roland Alpha Juno synthesizers (track 8) and programming * Joe Stelmach – art direction * Jonathan Owen MA(RCA) – cover illustration * Rob Page – graphics * Four Eyes – photography ;Production * Produced by Mr. Mister and Paul De Villiers * Production Coordinator – Marge Meoli * Recorded and Engineered by Paul De Villiers and Lois Oki * Additional Engineers – Bill Freesh and Tony Peluso * Assistant Engineers – T'Chad Blake, Judy Clapp, Carolyn Collins, Eddie Delena, Dave Egerton, Stuart Furusho, Heidi Hanscher, Coke Johnson, Stan Katayama, Daren Klein, Steve MacMillan, Richard Mekernan and Sebastian Thorer. * Mixed by Mick Guzauski and Mike Shipley * Mastered by Ted Jensen at Sterling Sound (New York, NY). ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- !
